title: Plural form -lar and -ler in Turkish
desc: Plural form of nouns in Turkish

body.raw:
## Plurals in Turkish - √áokluk Eki --- Let us take a look at how we can make words plural. It is the same like English in the sense that it comes at the end of the word. The letters that correspond to `s` , `es` or `ies` in English for plurality are **lar** and ********ler.******** Let us see this in play.
üí° Car ‚Üí Car**s** Flower ‚Üí Flowers Araba ‚Üí Araba******lar****** √ái√ßek ‚Üí √ái√ßek******ler******
You might be wondering when do we use **************ler************** and when do we use **********lar**********? In Turkish, for ease of pronunciation we pay attention to the **last vowel** of the word being in harmony with the **suffix** added.
üí° üìå If the last vowel is either `a` , `ƒ±` ,`o` ,`u` then ********lar******** is added to the word to make it plural. üìå If the last vowel is either `e`, `i`, `√∂` `√º` then **ler** is added to the word to make it plural.
| Last Vowel | Plural suffix | | --- | --- | | a-ƒ±-o-u | -**lar** | | e-i-√∂-√º | -**ler** | That‚Äôs why Cars is Araba**lar** and Flowers is √ái√ßek******ler.****** ### Using ‚Äúler‚Äù and ‚Äúlar‚Äù with Numbers When a word is preceded by a number in Turkish, we **do not** use the suffixes -**lar** and -**ler.**
üí° Five Books ‚Üí Be≈ü kitaplar ‚ùå ‚Üí Be≈ü kitap ‚úÖ Why is that? It is because the number **be≈ü** is already indicates its plural and to avoid redundancy.
üìå You will probably be like d√∂rt arabalar when you should instead say d√∂rt araba.It takes conscious effort to avoid it. --- Thanks for reading!
